summary: Website named "yammy nevliya" for world-famous food recipes with Hindi and English language support, including recipe photos and automatic addition of various recipe types.

existing_features.title: Implement a bilingual UI for Yammy Nevliya with a global language toggle (Hindi/English) that switches all recipe content fields and key UI labels across the app.

Build the primary frontend pages and navigation for the recipe site: (1) Home/Explore page with search and filters (category and cuisine), (2) recipe list/grid showing photo + key metadata, and (3) recipe detail page showing photo, metadata, ingredients, and steps.

Add an in-app recipe creation form that allows adding new recipes without code changes, including all bilingual fields (English + Hindi), metadata fields, and selecting a photoAssetPath from available static assets.

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a food/recipe site (colors, typography, layout, and components) and enforce it consistently across the header, navigation, cards, filters, forms, and detail pages (avoid blue/purple as primary colors).

Add generated static image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (logo/hero and a small set of recipe photos) and render them in the UI for site branding and seeded recipes via photoAssetPath.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a recipe website featuring world-famous food recipes
Add bilingual content support (Hindi and English)
Include recipe photos/images for each recipe
Automatically add/populate recipes of various types (auto-ingestion/auto-import)

Create the core recipe data model and persistence in the Motoko backend, including bilingual fields for each recipe (English + Hindi) and recipe metadata (id, titleEn, titleHi, descriptionEn, descriptionHi, ingredientsEn, ingredientsHi, stepsEn, stepsHi, cuisine, category, prepTimeMinutes, cookTimeMinutes, servings, photoAssetPath, createdAt).
Pre-populate (seed) the app with an initial set of world-famous recipes spanning multiple categories and cuisines, each including both English and Hindi content and an associated photo asset path.
Implement a bilingual (English/Hindi) UI with a global language toggle that switches all recipe content and key UI labels between English and Hindi.

Build the main user flows: (1) Home/Explore page with search and filters (category/cuisine), (2) Recipe list/grid with photos, (3) Recipe detail page showing ingredients and steps with photo and metadata.
Provide a simple in-app way to add new recipes (bilingual) so new recipe types can be added without code changes, including uploading/selecting a photo asset reference for the recipe.
Use a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a food/recipe site (colors, typography, layout, and components) and apply it consistently across pages.
Add generated static image assets (logo/hero + a small set of recipe photos) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI for the seeded recipes and site branding.

Create the Motoko backend data model and persistence for recipes, storing bilingual (English + Hindi) fields and metadata: id, titleEn, titleHi, descriptionEn, descriptionHi, ingredientsEn, ingredientsHi, stepsEn, stepsHi, cuisine, category, prepTimeMinutes, cookTimeMinutes, servings, photoAssetPath, createdAt.

Pre-populate (seed) the backend with an initial set of world-famous recipes spanning multiple categories and cuisines, each including both English and Hindi content and a valid photoAssetPath pointing to a frontend static asset.
Implement a bilingual UI (English/Hindi) with a global language toggle that switches all key UI labels and all recipe content fields between English and Hindi across the app.

Build the main frontend user flows for the recipe website: (1) Home/Explore page with search and filters (category and cuisine), (2) recipe list/grid that displays recipe photos and key metadata, and (3) a recipe detail page showing photo, metadata, ingredients, and steps.

Provide an in-app recipe creation form that allows adding new recipes without code changes, including bilingual fields (English + Hindi), metadata fields, and choosing a photoAssetPath from available static assets.
Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a food/recipe site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) and use it consistently across pages for Yammy Nevliya.
Add and render generated static image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated for site branding and seeded recipes (use these images in the UI via photoAssetPath and for a logo/hero).

Create a Motoko backend recipe data model and persistence for a single-canister app, storing bilingual fields and metadata for each recipe: id, titleEn, titleHi, descriptionEn, descriptionHi, ingredientsEn, ingredientsHi, stepsEn, stepsHi, cuisine, category, prepTimeMinutes, cookTimeMinutes, servings, photoAssetPath, createdAt.

Seed the backend with an initial set of world-famous recipes across multiple categories and cuisines (e.g., appetizers, main courses, desserts), ensuring every seeded recipe includes both English and Hindi content and a valid photoAssetPath that points to a frontend static asset.
